CodeList.Name: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis Version 4 Questionnaire Test Code

Description.TranslatedText: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis Version 4 test code.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: Because of my physical condition, I have trouble meeting the needs of my family.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Have Trouble Meeting Needs of Family Because of My Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I am able to work (include work at home).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Am Able to Work

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I have trouble walking.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Trouble Walking

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I have to limit my social activity because of my condition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Limit Social Activity Because of Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Have Strength in My Legs
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I have strength in my legs.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Strength in My Legs

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I have trouble getting around in public places.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Getting Around in Public Places

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Mobility: I have to take my condition into account when making plans.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Have to Take Condition Into Account When Making Plans

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I have nausea.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Nausea

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I have pain.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Pain

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I feel ill.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Ill

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I feel weak all over.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Weak All Over

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Have Pain in My Joints
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I have pain in my joints.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Pain in My Joints

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I am bothered by headaches.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Headaches

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Bothered by Muscle Pains
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Symptoms: I am bothered by muscle pains.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Muscle Pains

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I feel sad.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Sad

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I am losing hope in the fight against my illness.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Losing Hope in Fight Against My Illness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Able to Enjoy Life
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I am able to enjoy life.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Am Able to Enjoy Life

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Feel Trapped by My Condition
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I feel trapped by my condition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Trapped by My Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Depressed About My Condition
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I am depressed about my condition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Depressed About My Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I feel useless.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Useless

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Emotional Well-Being: I feel overwhelmed by my condition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Overwhelmed by My Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: My work (include work at home) is fulfilling.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - My Work is Fulfilling

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I have accepted my illness.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Have Accepted My Illness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-Enjoy Things I Usually Do for Fun
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I am enjoying the things I usually do for fun.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Enjoying Things I Usually Do for Fun

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-Content With Quality of My Life
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I am content with the quality of my life right now.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Content With Quality of My Life Now

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Frustrated by My Condition
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I am frustrated by my condition.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Am Frustrated by My Condition

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-Feel Sense of Purpose in My Life
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I feel a sense of purpose in my life.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Sense of Purpose in My Life

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Feel Motivated to Do Things
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - General Contentment: I feel motivated to do things.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Motivated to Do Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Have a Lack of Energy
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have a lack of energy.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Have a Lack of Energy

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I feel tired.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Tired

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have trouble starting things because I am tired.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Starting Things Because I Am Tired

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have trouble finishing things because I am tired.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Finishing Things Because I Am Tired

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Need to Rest During the Day
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I need to rest during the day.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Need to Rest During the Day

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have trouble remembering things.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Remembering Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have trouble concentrating.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Concentrating

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-My Thinking Is Slower Than Before
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: My thinking is slower than before.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - My Thinking is Slower Than Before

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Have Trouble Learning New Tasks
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Thinking and Fatigue: I have trouble learning new tasks or directions.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Learning New Tasks or Directions

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Feel Close to My Friends
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: I feel close to my friends.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Close to My Friends

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: I get emotional support from my family.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Get Emotional Support From Family

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Get Support From My Friends
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: I get support from my friends.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Get Support From Friends

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-My Family Has Accepted My Illness
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: My family has accepted my illness.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Family Has Accepted My Illness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: I am satisfied with family communication about my illness.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Satisfied With Family Communication About My Illness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: My family has trouble understanding when my condition gets worse.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Family Has Trouble Understanding When My Condition Gets Worse

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Feel Left Out of Things
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Family/Social Well-Being: I feel 'left out' of things.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Left Out of Things

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am bothered by side effects of treatment.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Side Effects of Treatment

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Forced to Spend Time in Bed
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am forced to spend time in bed.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Forced to Spend Time in Bed

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Feel Close to My Partner
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I feel close to my partner (or the person who is my main support).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Feel Close to My Partner

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Satisfied With My Sex Life
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am satisfied with my sex life.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Satisfied With My Sex Life

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-Satisfied With How I Am Coping
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am satisfied with how I am coping with my illness.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Satisfied With How I Am Coping With Illness

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I feel nervous.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Feel Nervous

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-Worry My Condition Will Get Worse
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I worry that my condition will get worse.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Worry My Condition Will Get Worse

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am sleeping well.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - I Am Sleeping Well

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: Heat worsens my symptoms.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Heat Worsens My Symptoms

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I have trouble controlling my urine.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Trouble Controlling My Urine

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I urinate more frequently than usual.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Urinate More Frequently Than Usual

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Bothered by the Chills
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am bothered by the chills.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Chills

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am bothered by fevers (episodes of high body temperature).
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Fevers

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: FAMS01-I Am Bothered by Muscle Spasms
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis - Additional Concerns: I am bothered by muscle spasms.
EnumeratedItem.nciodm:PreferredTerm: FAMS - Bothered by Muscle Spasms

CodeList.nciodm:CDISCSynonym: Functional Assessment of Multiple Sclerosis Version 4 Questionnaire Test Code
CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC Questionnaire FAMS Test Code Terminology
